parameters.parameter:
<%= #placeholder_entries = JSON.parse(@results['Retrieve Integration Config']['Values JSON']) integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] placeholders = JSON.parse( integration_config['Placeholder Data'] || "[]" )
## Review each placeholder and handle any replacements in the values field. # Set up source data source_data = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Data']
# Do replacements placeholders.each_index{|i| ph = placeholders[i]['value'] if !ph.nil? ph.gsub!(/\{\{(?:(?!\{\{).)*?\}\}/) do |match| # remove opening and closing brackets from match key = match[2..-3]
# determine which part of the field to retrieve - the 'display_value' or the 'value' field_qualifier = 'value' field = key field_array = key.split(".") if field_array.length > 0 if ["display_value","value"].include? field_array[1] field_qualifier = field_array[1] end field = field_array[0] end
if source_data.keys.include?(field) source_data[field][field_qualifier] || source_data[field] else match end end placeholders[i]['value'] = ph end }
placeholders.to_json %>

parameter.label: Error Handling
parameter.tooltip: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

parameter.label: Space Slug

parameter.tooltip: Slug of the form to query

parameter.tooltip: The index to use for the search/retrieval

parameter.label: Query
parameter.tooltip: A query that will retrieve a single submission

<%= integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] if @results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Title'].to_s.empty? notification_title = integration_config['Notification Message Template'] else notification_title = @results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Title'] end
{ "Onsolve Id" => @results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Notification Report UUID'], "Onsolve Status" => "Open", "OnSolve Notification Title" => notification_title }.to_json %>

parameters.parameter:
<%= recipients = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['Recipients JSON'] source_data = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Data']
# Do replacements if !recipients.nil? recipients.gsub!(/\{\{(?:(?!\{\{).)*?\}\}/) do |match| # remove opening and closing brackets from match key = match[2..-3]
# determine which part of the field to retrieve - the 'display_value' or the 'value' field_qualifier = 'value' field = key field_array = field.split(".") if field_array.length > 0 if ["display_value","value"].include? field_array[1] field_qualifier = field_array[1] end field = field_array[0] end
if source_data.keys.include?(field) source_data[field][field_qualifier] || source_data[field] else match end end end
recipients %>

task.label: Uses ServiceNow OnCall
task.value: JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['Use ServiceNow Oncall'].to_s == "Yes" && !JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['OnCall Support Group Id'].to_s.empty?

duration = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['Task History Duration'].to_i

}.to_json%>

parameters.parameter:
<%= oncall = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['OnCall Support Group Id'] source_data = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Data']
# Do replacements if !oncall.nil? oncall.gsub!(/\{\{(?:(?!\{\{).)*?\}\}/) do |match| # remove opening and closing brackets from match key = match[2..-3]
# determine which part of the field to retrieve - the 'display_value' or the 'value' field_qualifier = 'value' field = key field_array = field.split(".") if field_array.length > 0 if ["display_value","value"].include? field_array[1] field_qualifier = field_array[1] end field = field_array[0] end
if source_data.keys.include?(field) source_data[field][field_qualifier] || source_data[field] else match end end end
"group_ids=#{oncall}" %>

parameter.label: Error Handling
parameter.tooltip: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

parameter.label: Table
parameter.tooltip: The name of the table to retrieve info from (ie. change_request,incident, task,etc).

parameter.label: Query
parameter.tooltip: The query to retrieve objects. Use a '^' to seperate parameters.

parameters.parameter: <%= oncall_output = JSON.parse( @results['Retrieve OnCall']['object_json'] ) user_ids = oncall_output.map{ |x| "sys_id=#{x['userId']}" } query = user_ids.join("^OR") %>

parameter.label: Display Value
parameter.tooltip: Return field display values (true), actual values (false), or both (all) (default: false).

parameter.label: Exclude Reference Link
parameter.tooltip: True to exclude Table API links for reference fields (default: false).

parameter.label: Suppress Pagination Header
parameter.tooltip: True to supress pagination header (default: false).

parameter.label: Fields
parameter.tooltip: A comma-separated list of fields to return in the response.

parameters.parameter:
<%= service_now_identifier_field = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['User Field Containing Match to OnSolve Users']
"sys_id,#{service_now_identifier_field}" %>

parameter.label: Limit
parameter.tooltip: The maximum number of results returned per page (default: 10,000).

parameter.label: Query Category
parameter.tooltip: Name of the query category (read replica category) to use for queries.

parameters.parameter:
<%= # identify the field that we're pulling back from ServiceNow field = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['User Field Containing Match to OnSolve Users']
# put oncall users into a hash for easy lookup oncall_users = {} JSON.parse( @results['Get Oncall Users']['object_json'] ).each{|user| oncall_users[user['sys_id']] = user[field] }
oncall_results = JSON.parse( @results['Retrieve OnCall']['object_json'] )
simplified_oncall = {}
oncall_results.each{ |entry| order = entry['order'].to_i if !simplified_oncall.has_key? (order) simplified_oncall[order] = [] end user = oncall_users[entry['userId']] simplified_oncall[order].push(user) }
simplified_oncall.to_json %>

{ "Task Run Id" => @run['Id'], "Status" => "Errored", "Comments" => comments }.to_json %>

parameters.parameter:
<%= integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] notification_method_options = {"calloutInfo" => "Callout", "broadcastInfo" => "Broadcast", "bulletinBoardInfo" => "Bulletin Board", "firstResponseInfo" => "First Response"} notification_method = notification_method_options[integration_config['Notification Method']]
work_notes = ["Kinetic was unable to initiate the #{notification_method} \"#{integration_config['Notification Message Template']}\". Error message (if applicable):"] results = JSON.parse(@results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Output']) results['error'].each{|key,value| work_notes.push( "#{key}: #{value}" ) }
{ "work_notes" => work_notes.join("\n") }.to_json %>

parameter.label: Error Message Title
parameter.tooltip: The title of the error message to be send with the error notification

parameters.parameter:
<%= integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] source_data = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Data'] client_reference = source_data[integration_config['External Unique Key Field Name']]['display_value']
"Unable to initiate notification in MIR3 for #{client_reference} (integration: #{integration_config['Name']})" %>

parameter.label: Error Message Details
parameter.tooltip: The error message details to be sent with the error notification

parameters.parameter: <%= results = JSON.parse(@results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Output']) comments = "" results['error'].each{|key,value| comments << "\n#{key}: #{value}" } comments %>

parameter.label: Integration Id
parameter.tooltip: The Submission Id of the integration configuration record

parameter.label: Submission Id
parameter.tooltip: The Submission Id of the Task Activity Monitor record

parameter.label: Recipient List
parameter.tooltip: The receipient list to receive the notification

parameters.parameter: Decision was made to *always* update the Remedy ticket if there was an error in initiating the notification. For successful, we follow the configuration meaning we only post an update to the Remedy ticket if the configuration so indicates.

<%= integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] notification_method_options = {"calloutInfo" => "Callout", "broadcastInfo" => "Broadcast", "bulletinBoardInfo" => "Bulletin Board", "firstResponseInfo" => "First Response"} notification_method = notification_method_options[integration_config['Notification Method']]
# Build note work_notes = ["#{notification_method} Notification"] if @results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Title'].to_s.empty? work_notes.push( "\"#{integration_config['Notification Message Template']}\"" ) else work_notes.push( "\"#{@results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Title']}\"" ) end work_notes.push( "(UUID #{@results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Notification Report UUID']})" ) work_notes.push( "was successfully initiated" )
recipients = JSON.parse(@results['Do Recipient Replacements']['output']) if notification_method == "Callout" || notification_method == "First Response" if recipients.has_key?("Escalation Level 1") && !recipients['Escalation Level 1']['groups'].to_s.empty? work_notes.push( "to #{recipients['Escalation Level 1']['groups']}" ) end end if notification_method == "Broadcast" || notification_method == "Bulletin Board" if recipients.has_key?("groups") && !recipients['groups'].to_s.empty? work_notes.push( "to #{recipients['groups']}" ) end end
work_notes.join(" ")+"." %>

parameter.label: Table
parameter.tooltip: The name of the table to update the object in (ie. change_request,incident,task,etc).

parameter.label: Id
parameter.tooltip: The id of the object to update.

parameter.label: JSON Body
parameter.tooltip: The JSON body containing the fields that should be updated.

parameters.parameter: <%= integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] integration_config['Fields to Update Upon Notification'] %>

parameter.label: Notification Detail
parameter.tooltip: The title of the notification to be found and retrieved

parameter.label: Placeholder JSON
parameter.tooltip: An object that contains the placeholder names and values: [{"name":"placeholder name", "value":"placeholder value"},{"name":"placeholder name 2", "value":"placeholder value 2"}...]

parameter.label: MIR3 Individual Recipient Field
parameter.tooltip: The MIR3 field that contains the value(s) provided in the Individual Recipients List. Required field, even if individual receipients is not populated. Common values are 'employeeId' and 'username'

parameters.parameter:
<%= default = "username" unique_field = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['MIR3 Unique User Match Field']
if unique_field.to_s.empty? default else unique_field end %>

parameter.label: Recipients JSON
parameter.tooltip: JSON object of recipients in one of two formats {"individuals":"...","groups":"...","schedules":"..."} or {"Escalation Level 1":{"individuals":"...","groups":"...","schedules":"..."},"Escalation Level 2":{...}}}

parameter.label: OnCall JSON
parameter.tooltip: JSON object corresponding to Oncall, arranged as follows: {"1":["user1","user2"],"2":["user3"],...}

parameter.tooltip: The page to set the submission to

parameter.tooltip: A JSON Map of values to set into the submissions fields

parameters.parameter:
<%= integration_config = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration'] parameters = JSON.parse(integration_config['Initiation Standard Action Parameters']) source_data = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Data'] notification_method_options = {"calloutInfo" => "Callout", "broadcastInfo" => "Broadcast", "bulletinBoardInfo" => "Bulletin Board", "firstResponseInfo" => "First Response"} notification_method = notification_method_options[integration_config['Notification Method']]
work_notes = ["Kinetic was unable to initiate the #{notification_method} \"#{integration_config['Notification Message Template']}\". Error message (if applicable):"] results = JSON.parse(@results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Output']) results['error'].each{|key,value| work_notes.push( "#{key}: #{value}" ) }
{ "Status" => "New", "Source" => "ServiceNow", "Source Id" => JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Id'], "Source Reference Id" => source_data[integration_config['External Unique Key Field Name']], "UUID" => @results['MIR3 One Step Notification']['Notification Report UUID'], "Task Activity Monitor Record" => JSON.parse(@source['Data'])['Task Activity Monitor Submission'], "Related Activity Record" => @results['Add Activity Record']['Id'], "Action" => "Update", "Payload" => { "table" => integration_config['Schema Name'], "id" => JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Id'], "json_body" => { "work_notes" => work_notes.join("\n"), }.to_json }.to_json }.to_json %>

parameter.tooltip: True or False, if Submission should be Submitted when created

parameters.parameter:
<%= oncall = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Integration Configuration']['OnCall Support Group Id'] source_data = JSON.parse( @source['Data'] )['Source Data']
# Do replacements if !oncall.nil? oncall.gsub!(/\{\{(?:(?!\{\{).)*?\}\}/) do |match| # remove opening and closing brackets from match key = match[2..-3]
# determine which part of the field to retrieve - the 'display_value' or the 'value' field_qualifier = 'value' field = key field_array = field.split(".") if field_array.length > 0 if ["display_value","value"].include? field_array[1] field_qualifier = field_array[1] end field = field_array[0] end
if source_data.keys.include?(field) source_data[field][field_qualifier] || source_data[field] else match end end end
"group_ids=#{oncall}" %>
